mt.comm.socket

Class ClientCommSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • mt.comm.socket.ClientCommSocket

  • public class ClientCommSocket
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for handling sockets and streams between the server and a client.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ClientCommSocket(java.lang.String host, java.lang.String nickname, java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<ClientSideMessage> clientMessages)
      Constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void connect()
      This method is used to create the streams, IN and OUT for the socket created previously and to send a connected message to the server.
      void disconnect()
      This method is used to disconnect a client from the server and to stop the started thread that is handling the messages received from server.
      boolean isConnected()
      This method is used to validate if the is still connected to the server.
      void sendOrder(Order order)
      This method is used to send and client order to the server.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClientCommSocket

        public ClientCommSocket(java.lang.String host,
                        java.lang.String nickname,
                        java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<ClientSideMessage> clientMessages)
                 throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        host - The server host in which the server socket is available to receive new connections.
        nickname - The client nickname.
        clientMessages - Reference to the queue used to store the messages received from the server.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - Thrown if the server host is unknown.
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the socket could not be created.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect()
        This method is used to create the streams, IN and OUT for the socket created previously and to send a connected message to the server. It's also used to create a new thread responsible for handling the client messages received from the server.

      • sendOrder

        public void sendOrder(Order order)
        This method is used to send and client order to the server.
        Parameters:
        order - The order to be sent to the server.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        This method is used to disconnect a client from the server and to stop the started thread that is handling the messages received from server.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        This method is used to validate if the is still connected to the server.
        Returns:
        True if the client still connected otherwise false.
